details.flavorText: Esoboks are brute hunters and pugnacious sentinels that serve as the guard dogs of the Boneyard. These squat, powerful quadrupeds have a frill of dark feathers around their distinctive heads which resemble a crocodile skull. Esoboks rarely bother with those who are truly dead, allowing the dead of the Boneyard to go about their business while remaining watchful for danger. Though cunning when sniffing out threats to the Boneyard or to their psychopomp handlers, they're among the least intelligent of the psychopomps and rarely speak except to utter growling threats. The wise listen when an esobok makes a threat, as it won't do so twice.

description.value:
Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Invisible]{Invisible}. This makes it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Undetected]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Hidden]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Invisible]{Invisible}. This makes it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Undetected]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Hidden]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Invisible]{Invisible}. This makes it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Undetected]{Undetected} to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Hidden]{Hidden} to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

A monster with darkvision can see perfectly well in areas of darkness and dim light, though such vision is in black and white only. Some forms of magical darkness, such as a 4th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Darkness]{Darkness} spell, block normal darkvision. A monster with @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Greater Darkvision]{Greater Darkvision}, however, can see through even these forms of magical darkness.

Lifesense allows a monster to sense the vital essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. The sense can distinguish between the positive energy animating living creatures and the negative energy animating undead creatures, much as sight distinguishes colors.

Scent involves sensing creatures or objects by smell, and is usually a vague sense. The range is listed in the ability, and it functions only if the creature or object being detected emits an aroma (for instance, incorporeal creatures usually do not exude an aroma).

If a creature emits a heavy aroma or is upwind, the GM can double or even triple the range of scent abilities used to detect that creature, and the GM can reduce the range if a creature is downwind.
The esobok Strides and then makes a Strike. If it began this action @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Hidden]{Hidden}, it remains hidden until after the Strike.

An esobok's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Ghost Touch]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal [[/r 1d6 # negative damage]] negative damage to living creatures and [[/r 1d6 # positive damage]] positive damage to undead.

Requirement A creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Grabbed]{Grabbed} by the esobok's jaws;

Effect The esobok releases the target from the Grab but wrenches its spirit free as it does so. The creature must attempt a Will save. Creatures without souls (such as most constructs) and creatures whose bodies and souls are one (such as most celestials, fiends, and monitors) that roll a failure or critical failure on the save get a success instead.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stunned]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The esobok wrenches the target's soul from its body into its jaws. mindless undead creatures of level 2 or lower are destroyed, other undead creatures are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stunned]{Stunned} for 1 round, and all other creatures are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Paralyzed]{Paralyzed}. At the end of each of its turns, a creature paralyzed by this effect can attempt a new save to end the effect. The paralysis ends automatically if the esobok attempts a jaws Strike or speaks.

Critical Failure As failure, but as long as a creature is stunned or paralyzed, it is also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stupefied]{Stupefied 2}.

Requirements The monster's last action was a success with a Strike that lists Grab in its damage entry, or it has a creature grabbed using this action.

Effect The monster automatically Grabs the target until the end of the monster's next turn. The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Grabbed]{Grabbed} by whichever body part the monster attacked with, and that body part can't be used to Strike creatures until the grab is ended. Using Grab extends the duration of the monster's Grab until the end of its next turn for all creatures grabbed by it. A grabbed creature can use the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Escape]{Escape} action to get out of the grab, and the Grab ends for a grabbed creatures if the monster moves away from it.
